syllabus:
**English III: Literature and Culture**

**文學與文化**

Fall 2018

Instructor: Jessie Shao 邵毓娟                  Email: [ycshao@ntnu.edu.tw](mailto:ycshao@ntnu.edu.tw)

Office: Cheng 808                             Tel: 77341800 ext. 1786

Office Hours: (Tues. 12:00-14:00; Fris. 10:00-12:00)

**I. Goals:**

本課程希望透過閱讀當代文學作品來探索世界與自我。選出作品都放置在某些主題之下，希望同學們藉由文學作品所開創出的不同文學視角來思考與人的處境相關等各式議題。課程中也將選讀由日文譯成英文的當代作品，希望帶入不同的文化視野。本課程企圖藉由文學與文化議題的討論，希望同學們藉由閱讀英文文學作品，除了培養英文的閱讀能力之外，能夠藉由閱讀發展出一種具有人文與哲理厚度與批判性的思考態度與方法。

The goal of this course is to provide students with a reasonably compact introduction to   the study of the social, historical, cultural, and personal issues rendered and explored in contemporary literary works. The selected works will be studied in terms of basic aesthetic elements and critical concepts and approaches so as to heighten students’ sensibility of the aesthetic, critical, and ethical dimensions of literary works. Reading literary texts alongside some significant and universal themes is meant to help students develop an in-depth view of literary works as an aesthetic expression of contested social, historical, and cultural conditions and of the complexity of humanity.

**III. Requirements:**

1\. Finish assigned readings in advance of each class meeting.

2\. Follow basic classroom etiquette rules: Be punctual for class and send a notice to the instructor in advance when you cannot attend a class meeting.

3\. Attendance and participation are important. Discussing these texts with the instructor and your peers will enhance your understanding of the texts.

4\. **Individual work: 1.** **In-class worksheets:** The in-class worksheets are meant for attendance check and helping the instructor to understand students’ thoughts on some topics. Some of the topics will be based on the assigned TED Talk videos. **2\. Oral presentations**: You are required to give a number of presentations on the topics related to the assigned works. **3\. Online forum**: You are required to write a few words on the online forum. **4\. Final exam:** The final exam consists of two parts: an in-class vocabulary test and one written journal. The topics for the journal will be based on the reading list of this course.

5. **Group work**: 1. Group discussion: You are expected to work with class members on the given topics in class discussion. As a member of your group, you are expected to help facilitate group discussion and present the result for your group. 2. Midterm skit: In the Midterm week, each group is expected to perform a skit of their own creation. The theme and tone of the skit should be based on the play _Sure Thing_ by David Ives. The skit is expected to be about 3-5 minutes in length.

**IV. Grading Policy**: Your grade will be given based on your performance on the following

aspects:

1\. Attendance and participation 20%

2\. Group Work 20%

3\. Individual Work 60%: In-class worksheets (15%), oral presentations (20%), Online forum (10%), and final exam (15%).
